image.altText: two photos of a filthy bedroom

items.synopsis: The disability royal commission found the abuse and neglect faced by two brothers was sometimes "mistaken for disability-related behaviours".

title.children: Disability royal commission reveals Brisbane house of horrors

image.altText: Albanese stands speaking to media from a courtyard.

items.synopsis: The PM will use a speech to the ASEAN summit on Wednesday to release the government's South-East Asian Economic Strategy, a blueprint aimed at driving trade and investment north into the region.

title.children: Anthony Albanese starts summit season talking trade ties and regional security, with China in mind

image.altText: a man standing in a garage charging his electric vehicle

items.synopsis: On a sunny spring day, Robin can fully charge both his and his wife's electric vehicles by lunchtime. It could be a big step on the path to net zero.

title.children: Could electric cars charge the move to a net zero emissions future?

image.altText: Promo image of a line chart showing housing costs broken down by income.

items.synopsis: Housing costs are at record highs, and we can show you who is bearing the brunt of the crisis.

title.children: Where you sit on this chart determines your level of housing stress

image.altText: A man looks on, waving his arms

items.synopsis: Spain's beleaguered football federation sacks the coach of its national women's team, Jorge Vilda, less than three weeks after he oversaw its World Cup triumph in Australia.

title.children: Spain sacks World Cup-winning women's coach as post-tournament chaos continues

image.altText: A large concrete police station with a sign saying Mt Isa Police Headquarters.

items.synopsis: A 35-year-old woman is in a critical condition while an 18-year-old recovers in hospital, after a man allegedly stabbed them multiple times at a home in Mount Isa.

title.children: Man charged with attempted murder, rape after double stabbing in outback Queensland

image.altText: young girl on bus.

items.synopsis: From war-torn hills and valleys, to the sheep and wheat paddocks of remote Australia, the Karen people are determined to pass down their language and traditions to the next generation.

title.children: Karen refugees keep their culture alive in rural Australia after fleeing war in Myanmar

image.altText: Vanessa Hudson, the incoming Qantas CEO, with model plane in foreground showing Flying Kangaroo

items.synopsis: With Alan Joyce announcing his abrupt departure from Qantas two months ahead of schedule, Vanessa Hudson is now in control of an airline with a reputation problem — and disgruntled customers say it will be tough to win them back.

title.children: New Qantas CEO Vanessa Hudson faces an uphill battle to restore the public's faith as Alan Joyce departs

image.altText: premier annastacia palaszczuk at a vigil at night speaking into a microphone, a bright light is shining beside her

items.synopsis: Annastacia Palaszczuk has been a favourite topic of discussion at just about every media event held by Queensland ministers over the past week, despite the Labor premier being more than 15,000 kilometres away on holidays in southern Italy, writes Peter McCutcheon.

title.children: What's fuelling speculation about Annastacia Palaszczuk's leadership?

image.altText: A woman's hands holding two shells, seen from above

items.synopsis: A vast collection of Indigenous artefacts kept in England for decades is being returned to the Northern Territory, ending an "emotional" years-long repatriation process.

title.children: 'The first time I saw them it made me cry': Indigenous artefacts returned after decades in English museum

image.altText: A woman with a tan jumper and long brown hair leans on a wooden pole on her front porch, looking out to the distance.

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank leaves interest rates steady at 4.1 per cent for the third month in a row, but says further increases to rates may be needed to bring down inflation in line with its target.

title.children: Hannah is one of thousands of home owners seeing the light as RBA leaves rates on hold again

image.altText: Qantas CEO Alan Joyce speaks to the media during a press conference.

items.synopsis: Embattled Qantas boss Alan Joyce brings his retirement forward by two months after a horror period for the airline.

title.children: Alan Joyce abruptly departs Qantas after scandalous week and 'many ups and downs'

image.altText: A middle-aged white man in a suit with a yellow tie and glasses yells and points while speaking in parliament.

items.synopsis: Shadow Transport Minister Bridget McKenzie has accused the government of stifling competition by banning 21 additional Qatar Airways flights into major capital cities each week.

title.children: Senate inquiry to examine Qatar Airways decision as opposition wins crossbench support

image.altText: Coco Gauff clenches her fist

items.synopsis: Coco Gauff becomes the youngest American to reach the US Open semifinals since Serena Williams in 2001 with a straight-sets win over Jelena Ostapenko , while Novak Djokovic made short work of American Taylor Fritz in straight sets.

title.children: Coco Gauff emulates Serena Williams with straight-sets win, Novak Djokovic cruises through

image.altText: A pair of hands wearing fingerless gloves using a laptop computer in a dark room.

items.synopsis: A notorious Russian ransomware gang which infiltrated one of Australia's largest law firms has now targeted a string of Victorian businesses, including a pathology company.

title.children: Cyber criminals threaten 'catastrophe' after claiming data theft from Australian businesses

image.altText: A German tennis player looks off to the side of the court as he cups his hand to his ear as if to hear what is being said.

items.synopsis: Alexander Zverev wins his late-night fourth round tie at the US Open, but only after the German is shocked and angered by a fan calling "the most famous Hitler phrase there is" at Flushing Meadows.

title.children: 'He just said the most famous Hitler phrase there is': Fan removed from Zverev clash for Nazi slur

image.altText: People take part in the annual LGBT pride parade in Hong Kong.

items.synopsis: The ruling comes after a dismissal of an appeal from jailed democracy and LGBTQI+ rights activist Jimmy Sham.

title.children: Top Hong Kong court urges new legal framework for LGBTQI+ couples

image.altText: A wide body of water with land and trees in the middle

items.synopsis: Australia's most ambitious environmental reform is about to get a shake-up, so here's your guide to why we have a Murray-Darling Basin Plan and how it might change.

title.children: What is the Murray-Darling Basin Plan and why does the federal government want to change it?

image.altText: A koala sits on the edge of a nursery table near a wooden post, looking towards a nearby collection of seedlings.

items.synopsis: After several months of illicit gorging at a NSW nursery, Claude the koala has been caught in the act.

title.children: Claude the leaf thief devours $6k worth of seedlings intended for koala habitat

image.altText: A section of the Great Wall of China from above

items.synopsis: Two people have been detained after using an excavator to dig a hole through the Great Wall of China in order to cut down on travel time, state media reports.

title.children: Two arrested after digging hole through Great Wall of China

image.altText: ambulance and police cars line street

items.synopsis: A police officer is taken to hospital after an allegedly stolen car crashes into several cars in Wollongong. Officers allege the driver was involved in other police pursuits over the past three days.

title.children: Police officer injured as allegedly stolen vehicle crashes into four cars during pursuit

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses sitting raising an arm with a missing hand.

items.synopsis: More than 300 people were killed and over 600 wounded by the controversial weapons in Ukraine in 2022, according to an international watchdog.

title.children: Ukraine tops global list of countries for most cluster bomb deaths

image.altText: An undated photo of Frank Foley and his son, Shaun.

items.synopsis: Human remains located by a fossicker last year have been linked to Frank Foley's close-living relatives, and police will conduct a forensic search at the site today.

title.children: Queensland police hope 'offenders can be brought to justice' after cold case breakthrough

image.altText: Once a ski slope remains barren with no snow, just grass.

items.synopsis: Selwyn Snow Resort has had a rough few years following the 2019/2020 Black Summer bushfires, with operators hoping 2024 will be kinder.

title.children: These ski slopes would normally still be dusted with snow, but a warm winter put an end to that

image.altText: A young boy is smiling in a red t-shirt.

items.synopsis: The former foster parents are facing charges of assault and intimidation of a child in a five-day hearing in Sydney.

title.children: Tyrrell's former foster mother sobs as secret recordings from her home and car played in court

image.altText: A drone shot of muddy tire tracks throughout a grassy field.

items.synopsis: Rangers in North Queensland have fined a four-wheel drive owner and towing company after their "deep wheel ruts" scared protected wetlands.

title.children: 4WD owner and towing company fined after treating wetlands as 'playground'

image.altText: Close up of sign at court house.

items.synopsis: The Burdekin Roosters stand down longstanding coach Jason Williams after he is charged with alleged offences spanning two-and-a-half years.

title.children: North Queensland rugby league coach charged with 32 child exploitation offences

image.altText: male patient in transfer bed with padding over his injured eye

items.synopsis: Stephan Giersberg is "incredibly lucky" he didn't lose his eye when a nail lodged in his eyeball while he was renovating his home.

title.children: Handyman warns of DIY dangers after 'very, very serious' nail gun injury

image.altText: Plastic playground equipment in the front yard of a childcare centre, seen through a metal fence.

items.synopsis: A child dies two days after being taken to Royal Darwin Hospital in a critical condition.

title.children: Police investigating death of toddler after medical incident at Darwin childcare centre

image.altText: A dark-haired boy standing on a boardwalk in bushland. His face is blurred and he cannot be identified.

items.synopsis: The boy's devastated family has been told he is likely to spend months in hospital. A 27-year-old man has been charged over the Sunshine Coast incident.

title.children: Boy, 12, on life support after being knocked off scooter by alleged drunk driver on Father's Day

image.altText: An aerial view of dense forest with mist in some of the valleys.

items.synopsis: The Chalumbin Wind Farm, which will now be known as the Wooroora Station Wind Farm, is scaled back to 42 turbines.

title.children: Controversial wind farm planned near World Heritage area downsized again and renamed
